title: An enjoyable film, but suffers in Disney's shadow
review: Antz, on it's own, would have been a good movie, if you enjoy Woody Allen's neurotic characters and self-depreciating one-liners.  When held up to the same standard as 'A Bug's Life', however, it's looks like a cheap immitation.  I don't know how these movies spontaneously pop up -- like one year we get a pair of asteroid movies, the next, a pair of animated ant movies -- but 'Antz' is worth seeing once.  'A Bugs Life' is worth owning, you'll want to watch it again and again, uh, I mean your kids will want to watch it again and again.

title: This film is flash with no substance
review: This movie is total flash with absolutely no substance.  Potato Chips for couch potatos.  The stylization is flat.  It would seem from the other reviewers that if you find a bunch of 1930's outfits and cars that your movie is now 'stylized'.  And what's with Kim Basinger?  The big shoker is that we see a photo of the detective kissing a prostitute on the floor with all her clothes on?  Oh my god!  I can overlook a few plot and motivation flaws (there were many in this move), but what's the big payoff here?  An ending riddled in cliches.  This movie has all the empty calories of a can of Pringles.  I'm mystified at positive response people gave this one.
